results.title: Pacific terminal
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Information and Government of NSW
results.brief_description: A survey of the capital city of New South Wales, Sydney on Port Jackson. Includes aerial footage of Sydney; monuments in Macquarie Place; inland footage of shearers and bullocks hauling logs; and Australians enjoying a range of recreational activities.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Commonwealth Department of Information and Government of NSW

results.creator_credit: Peter Dimond, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Australia presents: Christmas in Australia
results.creator_credit: Richard Mason, Jack S. Allan and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Australia’s Christmas is not the traditional day of snow and ice, but a warm sweltering day in mid-summer. The old traditions are preserved.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Mason, Jack S. Allan and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.description: Australia’s Christmas is not the traditional day of snow and ice, but a warm sweltering day in mid-summer. This film shows typical scenes of Christmas celebrations in 1950’s Australia, from the busy shops and streets of the cities, to small churches of rural country towns, even a festive feast at the beach.
description_for_label: Australia’s Christmas is not the traditional day of snow and ice, but a warm sweltering day in mid-summer. This film shows typical scenes of Christmas celebrations in 1950’s Australia, from the busy shops and streets of the cities, to small churches of rural country towns, even a festive feast at the beach.

results.title: A Place to live
results.creator_credit: Stuart Glover, Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Film Academy
results.brief_description: Story of immigration and discussion of how newcomers look for houses, units or commission housing on offer in the city. Immigration officers help migrants get loans and settle in ‘suburbia’, the ideal for many migrants.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stuart Glover, Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Film Academy

results.title: Ray of hope
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Maslyn Williams and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Designed for use in a national campaign against tuberculosis, this film describes the disease and preventive measures being taken to eradicate the disease from Australia. Shows the use of chest X-ray in detecting the disease; symptoms, nature and spread of tuberculosis; treatment of patients at sanatorium; importance of keeping children free from infection; use of BCG vaccine for the immunization of school children.

results.title: Postcard from Perth
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Perth, far removed from the main centres of Austraian life and industry, is a quiet and peaceful city [1954]. Folks relax and do not seem to hurry. This film reflects somewhat, the leisure and and activities of the people of Perth in the 1950s.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shan Benson, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board

results.title: The New Ipswich
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson and Australian news and Information Bureau
results.brief_description: The story of the way of life of the people in Ipswich, Queensland. Scenes include: the Alan Cunnigham memorial (explorer) railway workshop, woollen mill, timber mill and coal mines, schools and leisure activities. Music by Robert Hughes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric Thompson and Australian news and Information Bureau

results.title: Getting even: women in Australian politics
results.brief_description: In 1894 South Australia became one of the first places in the world to grant women the right to vote and first in the world to allow them to stand as candidates for political office. In 1902, the first Parliament of Australia granted white women the right to vote and to stand for election. Despite this, only 61 women have been elected to Federal Parliament in Australia to date. This film looks at why women’s efforts for greater representation have been continually frustrated, and asks what it is that motivates those women who have made it into the main political game. Female politicians from across the political spectrum talk about their experiences in the ‘boy’s club’ of Australian politics. Australia’s first female Premiers, Carmen Lawrence and Joan Kirner, reflect on their experiences of working at the top of State politics. Bronwyn Bishop, Cheryl Kernot, Amanda Vanstone and others, reveal what lies behind the public face of today’s female politicians. This film also examines the future for women in power, and examines the strategies being used by both major political parties to redress the gender imbalance in our parliaments. The film asks what it really takes for a woman to make it in politics. Has the hard won vote been an effective tool for change or has the political system acted to limit women’s influence? Narrated by Gillian Jones.

results.title: Brisbane: city in the sun
results.creator_credit: Hugh McInnes, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the pattern of life in Brisbane, Queensland. Aspects such as commerce, tourist appeal and the social pastimes of locals and tourists are depicted. Includes views of the races, the beach and Brisbane River. Camera: Edward Cranstone Sound: Donald Kennedy Music: Don Andrews

results.title: City in the sun
results.creator_credit: Alasdair Loch and Australian news and Information Bureau
results.brief_description: Inspired by Arne Sucksdorff’s “Manniskor i Stad” (Rhythm of a city), this film reflects the mood of a day in the life of Sydney, New South Wales, from morning until night.
